channel.title: MorningBrew as a feed
channel.description: This is a feed of recent MorningBrew articles published by Huginn

item.title: The WHO Declares Covid-19 a Global Pandemic: 1 Year Later
item.description: In the US, 1 in 4 adults in the US have now received their first vaccine dose, per the White House. In the US, almost 528,000 people have died due to Covid; a year ago today, the US death toll was 38. Health: Nearly 118 million people globally fell ill with the coronavirus, and 2.6 million people have died.  It’s been a long year. still soared (Norwegian Cruise Line +206%). Stimulus: Including the latest stimulus bill, DC will have spent more than $5 trillion on emergency aid for Americans over the past year.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Latest Covid Relief Package Includes Support for Restaurants, Event Venues
item.description: Restaurants: The bill contains a $28.6 billion “revitalization fund” that will dole out grants to cover pandemic-related revenue shortfalls.  Event venues: They received $1.25 billion in grant money, on top of the $15 billion the live entertainment industry secured in the stimulus package approved in December.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Roblox Pops 7.75% In Its Public Debut
item.description: Roblox, an online multiplayer video game platform, popped 7.75% in its public debut yesterday to finish trading with a market cap of $38 billion. This method ensures that company shareholders themselves, not investment banks, capture more of the stock’s gains.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: The Fukushima Disaster: 10 Year Anniversary and the Impact on Energy
item.description: Zoom out: Some of that uneasiness around nuclear energy has spread to other countries since the disaster, including Germany.    What happened next: the worst nuclear disaster since Chernobyl in 1986. Only two (out of about 1,700) took them up on it, and the home of the mayor of one of those towns was targeted by a Molotov cocktail.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: How Startup Funding Works
item.description: , work? If you have any other questions on business or the economy, ask here.  The Brew's A: Startups typically fund themselves by raising money from outside investors, and each time they do, it's called a funding "round."  Series B: Your business model has proven itself, but you need to expand.  Series A: Launch time. ) into the public markets.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: March 10
item.description: Biden's relief plan alone will lift global economic growth by one whole percentage point this year, the OECD's chief economist told the FT.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Offshore Wind Project In Martha's Vineyard Nears Approval
item.description: It'd be a breakthrough for domestic offshore wind in the US, and the Biden administration hopes this project will kick the industry into high gear.  About two dozen East Coast wind projects are in various stages of development, and several states in the region have promised to purchase at least 25,000 MW of offshore power by 2035.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Microsoft Hack Expands to Estimated 60,000 Victims
item.description: Last Tuesday, Microsoft issued security patches (which users must manually install) to prevent further intrusions.  Tens of thousands of Asian and European organizations are also affected, including the European Banking Authority. Now, it may have to do the same with China.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Disney+ Reaches Over 100 Million Subscribers
item.description: Yesterday, Disney CEO Bob Chapek announced that streaming service Disney+ has notched over 100 million subscribers just 16 months after launch.   It took Netflix nearly six years (after it first began reporting streaming sub numbers) to hit 100 million subscribers.  Bottom line: Though Disney+ is growing rapidly, Disney isn't making nearly as much money per subscriber as Netflix does. Now it's projecting 230–260 million by 2024, which would mean surpassing Netflix.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: How Startup Funding Works

If you have any other questions on business or the economy, ask here.  Our A: Startups typically fund themselves by raising money from outside investors, and each time they do, it's called a funding "round."  Series B: Your business model has proven itself, but you need to expand.  Series A: Launch time. ) into the public markets. You've achieved proof of concept, and investors are analyzing data on what you achieved with past investments.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Disney+ Reaches Over 100 Million Subscribers
item.description: Yesterday, Disney CEO Bob Chapek announced during the company's annual shareholder meeting that streaming service Disney+ has notched over 100 million subscribers just 16 months after launch. It took Netflix nearly six years (after it first began reporting streaming sub numbers) to hit 100 million subscribers.  Bottom line: Though Disney+ is growing rapidly, Disney isn't making nearly as much money per subscriber as Netflix does.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Microsoft Hack Expands to Estimated 60,000 Victims
item.description: Last Tuesday, Microsoft issued security patches (which users must manually install) to prevent further intrusions. After disclosing that Chinese hackers infiltrated its Exchange email server, Microsoft's hack has escalated this week from bad (stolen emails) to worse (hackers installing backdoors) to a Fyre Fest sequel.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Discord Keeps Pandemic Momentum Going
item.description: Started in 2015 as a place for friends to chat while playing video games, Discord has grown into a platform for more communities to connect.  For instance, there's a 400+ person Discord server called Parrot's Nest, which provides a forum for parrot owners. Zoom out: Discord is a force in the amateur investing community.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: North American Box Office Has Best Pandemic Weekend
item.description: Universal just delayed its newest Fast and Furious film again from May to June while it waits for more international markets to reopen. Kong (now scheduled for March 31) and A Quiet Place II (May 28). After a year with every release being pushed back, some studios are finally moving premieres up, including Godzilla v.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Stimulus Update: House Expected to Pass Bill Today
item.description: In the US, 2.5 million women left the labor force between February 2020 and January 2021, compared to 1.8 million men. For context, overall unemployment hit a record 14.8% last April. We had a 3.5% unemployment rate before the pandemic and there was no sign of inflation increasing," she told MSNBC.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Cathie Wood and Ark Innovation Are Off to a Tough Start in 2021
item.description: Ark's five exchange-traded funds (ETFs) have all dropped over 20% since early February, and its flagship fund, Ark Innovation, has declined for three weeks in a row. One example: Tesla accounts for around 10% of Ark Innovation. And Ark is particularly sensitive to any moves away from higher-risk tech stocks because it has so much exposure to them.  In 2020, Ark Innovation became the largest actively managed ETF in the world, with $17 billion in assets under management. That position made Wood look like a genius when Tesla gained almost 8x last year, but stocks don't always go up.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: Discord Keeps Pandemic Momentum Going
item.description: Started in 2015 as a place for users to chat with friends while playing video games, Discord has grown into a platform for more people than just gamers to connect. After the original Wall Street Bets Discord server was banned for hate speech during the height of meme stock mania in January, the new server has already amassed over 592,000 members.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: Cathie Wood and Ark Innovation Are Off to a Tough Start in 2021
item.description: But after another brutal day yesterday when Ark Innovation dropped nearly 6%, overall sentiment toward Ark may be shifting—short interest in Ark Innovation rose to its highest level ever last Thursday. One example: Tesla accounts for around 10% of Ark Innovation. And Ark is particularly sensitive to any moves away from higher-risk tech stocks because it has so much exposure to them.  Ark's five exchange-traded funds (ETFs) have all dropped over 20% since early February, and its flagship fund, Ark Innovation, has declined for three weeks in a row.

item.title: How Much Do You Know About Tax Write-offs? Take This 6-Question Quiz to Find Out
item.description: 100% 75% 50% 25% Answers: 1) e 2) true 3) c 4) true 5) b 6) a, to encourage more people to eat at restaurants in 2020; it’s normally 50%  True or false: You can write off up to $5,000 in startup costs within the first year of active trade or business. What is the 2020 standard mileage rate determined by the IRS for calculating tax-deductible business travel? Which of the following ad formats to promote your business are tax deductible?  5.  $600 $900$1,500 $2,000 4.  3. 1.
item.author: Devin Tomb

item.title: NFT of Jack Doresey’s First Tweet Ever Fetches Bid of $2.5 Million
item.description: Bottom line: Dorsey’s tweet will remain on Twitter and will be free to look at. If your answer was, “absolutely nothing, it’s just a tweet,” then you probably haven’t been following the recent NFT craze.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: Oprah Interviews Prince Harry and Meghan Markle in Major TV Event
item.description: So far, they’ve mostly followed the traditional playbook:Deal with Netflix: Last September, they announced a content deal with the streamer worth a reported $100 million. Meghan told Oprah that her life as a British royal was so suffocating that she contemplated suicide. it’s only a matter of time, right? SPAC: Just kidding, but...
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Senate Passes $1.9 Trillion Stimulus Bill
item.description: This bill wasn’t quite the bipartisan effort Biden had originally hoped for. $1,400 stimulus checks: Individuals earning up to $75,000 and couples making up to $150,000 qualify for the entire amount.  Quick note on process: The House originally passed the stimulus bill, then the Senate tweaked it and passed its own version this weekend. For the second straight March, the Senate passed an enormous bill aimed at providing relief to Americans suffering financially from the coronavirus pandemic.  Bottom line: Workers and families will have received $2.2 trillion from all of the coronavirus stimulus measures, according to the nonpartisan Committee for a Responsible Federal Budget.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Senate Passes $1.9 Trillion Stimulus Bill
item.description: This bill wasn’t quite the bipartisan effort Biden had originally hoped for. $1,400 stimulus checks: Individuals earning up to $75,000 and couples making up to $150,000 qualify for the entire amount. For the second straight March, the Senate passed an enormous bill aimed at providing relief to Americans suffering financially from the coronavirus pandemic.  Quick note on process: The House originally passed the stimulus bill, then the Senate tweaked it and passed its own version this weekend.  Bottom line: Workers and families will have received $2.2 trillion from all of the coronavirus stimulus measures, according to the nonpartisan Committee for a Responsible Federal Budget.

item.title: The Greatest Product of All Time Bracket Challenge
item.description: The product with more votes when the polls close will advance to the next round.  Over the next two weeks, Morning Brew readers will have the opportunity to select the Greatest Product of All Time (GPOAT).  How does a product advance through the bracket? what makes a product “great”? We’ll start with 64 products, separated into four different “regions” of 16 products. Some products truly are great.  How it works: The competition mirrors the format of the NCAA’s March Madness tournament.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: How to File Your Taxes as an S-corp
item.description: Here’s an example: Let’s say you’re a shareholder of an S-corp called Debi’s Awesome Snacks.    Taxes for S-corps and C-corps are due on March 15 so that shareholders have the info they need to file individual income taxes before April 15. which spits out a K-1 and is filed with each owner’s personal income taxes (this is how income tax transfers from business to owner). An S-corp is not as well known but offers a key advantage for qualifying LLCs and C-corps: Income taxes are passed through to the shareholders’ tax returns. We’ve gone over how to file your taxes as a sole proprietor and a Limited Liability Corporation (LLC), two very common ways to incorporate a business. So let us be clear: Attempting to DIY your taxes as an S-corp is like skiing up the mountain instead of taking a lift.
item.author: Devin Tomb

item.title: Biden Prepares to Eliminate $10,000 in Student Loans
item.description: This year, President Biden is expected to tackle the mounting student loan crisis with a powerful weapon: forgiveness. Forgive $10,000, which would clear balances for a third of borrowers and put a nice dent into outstanding balances for the largest group of borrowers, who hold between $20k–$40k. About 45 million Americans have outstanding student loans. Many may never have completed their degrees. The government could also expand loan forgiveness programs or enroll more borrowers in income-based repayment plans. But not everyone, even within his own party, agrees on how much he should forgive—or whether he should at all. Critics of student loan forgiveness argue that it benefits an already privileged class (college grads) and doesn’t address the root problem of expensive tuition. The state of student debt There’s a lot of it.  Biden’s optionsDo nothing. A generous gift...
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Some Dr. Seuss Books Discontinued, Others Make Amazon’s Bestseller List
item.description: 15 books on Amazon’s Top 20 list were Seuss publications as of Friday morning.
